Hello everyone!

I didn't want to start a new topic, so I post in this exis=
ting 
thread. Here it comes:
First of all, I'm using the Java version of NE=
AT (JNEAT), maybe the 
fitness variables are named differently in the C+ NE=
AT, but I think 
you will all understand my question. It's about the differ=
ence 
between the two variables "fitness" and "orig_fitness". 
The way I un=
derstand this is the following:
1a. orig_fitness is the organism's real fit=
ness value, which is 
determined only once, when the organism is created an=
d evaluated.
1b. orig_fitness never changes.
2a. fitness, on the other hand=
, is subject of later adjustments. Two 
processes can change the value of f=
itness: 
2b. First, fitness is divided among the subjects of the same speci=
es, 
meaning the more organisms in one species, the lower the fitness.
2c. =
Second, age_significance allows nishing by raising the fitness of 
young or=
ganisms.
3. When deciding which organism is better than another, orig_fitne=
ss 
is the only logic choice. Fitness is only a internal value for NEAT 
an=
d not important for me, who wants only the one and only best 
organism at t=
he end.

If someone could help me out and tell me if all of the above 
assu=
mptions are correct (or in case they are not explain to me how it 
is) I wo=
uld be very happy. 
Thanks a lot!
With best regards,
Matthias
